title: How to Improve Your Thinking Skills

steps.title: The best way to breathe is through your belly.
steps.content: The best way to breathe is through your belly. Take several slow breaths from your belly. Stomach breathing activates your brain, helps you relax, and reduces stress and tension. [1] X Research source This may help improve your thinking skills and memory. Deep breathing also increases the oxygen flow to your brain cells. As a result they become more active. [2] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source

steps.title: Studies show that chewing gum may improve your concentration skills.
steps.content: Studies show that chewing gum may improve your concentration skills. Chewing gum increases the flow of blood to your brain, which can enhance your memory and cognitive performance. [3] X Research source Research also suggests that chewing gum allows you to concentrate for longer and remember new information better. [4] X Research source Opt for sugar free gum to avoid any side effects. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Do 10 to 15 sets of arm circles.
steps.content: Do 10 to 15 sets of arm circles. To do an arm circle, extend your arm straight out to the front. Then, swing your arm all the way behind you and back to the front. [6] X Research source Always keep your elbow blocked while performing these exercises. This will increase your heart rate, which is good for your brain.

steps.title: Puzzles and brainteasers force your mind to get into active mode.
steps.content: Puzzles and brainteasers force your mind to get into active mode. According to board certified brain health physician Michael Lewis, MD, MPH, MBA, FACPM, FACN, “keeping your mind active is [important for good brain health].” This includes “crossword puzzles, regular tabletop puzzles, Sudoku, electronic games that test your memory, or chess.”

steps.title: Drink 6 to 8 cups of water each day.
steps.content: Drink 6 to 8 cups of water each day. Many people are dehydrated all the time and don't realize it, and this can impact your brain function. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Studies show that tension, depression, and confusion scores go down as your water intake increases. [8] X Trustworthy Source US Occupational Safety and Health Administration U.S. government agency responsible for setting and enforcing workplace safety standards Go to source So, make sure you drink enough water throughout the day. [9] X Research source Avoid sodas, coffee, or sugary drinks. They can decrease your ability to concentrate and remember things. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Consuming too much fat or sugar can negatively affect your thinking skills.
steps.content: Consuming too much fat or sugar can negatively affect your thinking skills. Not eating can make you tired. Therefore, you should strive to eat healthy, balanced meals every day. Include foods that are linked to better brain power, such as fish, vegetables, berries, walnuts, and whole grains. [11] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Adopt a Mediterranean-style diet, DASH diet, or MIND diet for better brain health. All 3 diets emphasize limiting red meat, focusing on whole foods, and avoiding saturated fats. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Stimulate your senses while studying to improve retention.
steps.content: Stimulate your senses while studying to improve retention. Different parts of your brain store different types of memories. For example, images are stored in one area and sounds in another. Creating a multisensory learning environment while writing an essay or preparing for an exam may potentially improve your recall. [13] X Research source For example, you could listen to ambient music to improve your concentration while studying. Or, play with a fidget spinner or stress ball to relieve stress.

steps.title: Allot a specific amount of time to learn the material.
steps.content: Allot a specific amount of time to learn the material. Try to divide the material you need to learn into sections. Maybe you could spend 10 minutes reading, 20 minutes reviewing, and 10 minutes reciting. This will force you to focus because you know that your time is limited. [14] X Research source
